title: Add second title screen after post-Yes meme with stylish hero typography

file_operations.description: Refactor the post-"Yes" flow from a single boolean (showResult) into a simple multi-view state (e.g., prompt -> meme -> title) rendered within the same React app. Keep the existing meme screen content intact, add a distinct title screen view that renders the exact string "NABIHA SHINWARI LOVE YOU" (no extra characters/casing changes), and wire navigation from meme -> title via an in-app control. Use the shadcn-ui Button component for consistent controls; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply stylish, high-contrast, responsive hero typography to the title text while keeping all other UI copy in English.
acceptanceCriteria: On typical desktop widths, the title appears as the primary focal element and fits without clipping/overlap.
On mobile/tablet widths, the title remains readable (responsive sizing/line breaks) and stays centered.
All additional UI copy (buttons/labels) remains in English.

Ensure the styling supports responsive layouts without clipping. (Do not add non-English UI copy here.)

Apply the new title hero styling to the title screen text "NABIHA SHINWARI LOVE YOU" using responsive Tailwind classes and/or the new global class so the text stays centered and readable on desktop and mobile/tablet. Keep all other user-facing text (buttons/labels) in English. Use shadcn-ui Button where applicable; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

acceptanceCriteria: After clicking "Yes! ðŸ’•", the user sees the existing meme content and has an obvious control to proceed to the title screen.

file_operations.description: On the meme screen, add a clear proceed control (e.g., "Next"/"Continue") that navigates to the title screen without changing the existing romantic theme. Ensure the same background gradient and the hearts pattern background remain present on the prompt screen, meme screen, and title screen (reuse a shared wrapper/section in this file to avoid styling drift).
